citeinfo.origin: National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Mean Daily Extremes Temperature, Mean Monthly Precipitation, Mean and Extreme Sea Surface Temperature, Typhoons, and Clouds for Asia

abstract.p: Publication Title: Far East climatic atlas / prepared by Technical Services, 20th Weather Squadron.

Contains summarized charts of mean daily maximum and minimum temperatures; mean monthly precipitation; mean maximum and minimum sea temperatures; percentage of time cloud cover is less than 3/10; percentage of time ceiling and visibility are 5000/5, 1000/3, and 500/2; number of days with precipitation, thunderstorm, snow, snow cover; and typhoon tracks. Data are for the Far East covering the area of 90-165 degrees E and 10-60 degrees N.
Call No. QC990.A1 F3 1965 archive - available at the National Climatic Data Center Library, Asheville, North Carolina, U.S.A.

descript.purpose: This publication is in the National Climatic Data Center's Foreign Data Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by the NCDC from many nations over the years.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
